channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overflowing dog poo bin, 9th September
item.description:
Bin needs emptying on the Melville Rd side of the bridge
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog faeces on pavement, 9th September
item.description:
Trail of dog faeces on pavement between Gloucester Road and Honeybourne cycle track bridge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Market Street, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping on Brockhampton lane, 9th September
item.description:
Plasterboard etc has been tipped on Brockhampton Lane.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 20"x20" pothole at the edge of the road adjacent to the pavement., 8th September
item.description:
These potholes have been patched up several times but always break down after a spell of rain as a large puddle collects in the dip in the road and traffic going through the water churn up the poor surface of the tarmac. This problem will grow as the winter weather comes along.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shearwater Grove, Innsworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Faulty traffic lights, 8th September
item.description:
Filter lane light into Benhall goes Red with the main A40 westbound lights. Filter lane should only turn red when the pedestrian crossing lights are triggered. This is causing unnecessary delays and increased pollution
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sign Gravel Walk, 8th September
item.description:
The replacement sign has been sited (too far away from the boundary) this is causing an issue to vehicles, particularly deliveries. The narrowness of the lane has become a real problem. The original sign was located on the wall giving extra width to the lane. The debris and rubble on the left has narrowed the lane even further. Visitors and deliveries refuse to use.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gravel Walk, Southam, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over grown, poor tarmac, 7th September
item.description:
All the way down the alleyway the tarmac is all cracked and there is random lumps of higher tarmac that my pushchair got stuck on and tipped forwards and I nearly went over with it. If it wasn’t for my partner grabbing the pushchair with my 16 week old baby in it! Also seriously over grown with stinging nettles and full of dog poo. It’s used a lot by school runs and it’s dreadful

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19a, Ennerdale Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 7th September
item.description:
Someone has dumped plaster board & general builders waste in lay-by in Brockhampton Lane.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brockhampton Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 7th September
item.description:
Items dumped on this narrow road, causing a potential traffic issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: All street lighting out, 6th September
item.description:
All the street lighting has been out in Greatfield Drive since there was a power cut on Monday 3rd/4th night and Monday 4th for most of the day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Greatfield Drive, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footway not maintained between Albemarle Gate, Cheltenham, and Stoke Road, Bishop's Cleeve, 6th September
item.description:
Pavement cracked, crumbling and riddled with weeds. Width of pavement much reduced by encroaching vegetation including brambles and nettles as well as tree branches. Also nothing to help pedestrians cross busy junctions with Swindon Lane, Hyde Lane, and A435.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Gate, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown bushes, 6th September
item.description:
Saw a disabled elderly gentleman on his mobility scooter get his face scratched trying to get past the bushes that have been left to over grow. You can’t even get a push chair past it! It’s dangerous as it’s right on the corner so pedestrians are stepping into the road to get past it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Kingsmead Avenue, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath overgrown with nettles and brambles., 6th September
item.description:
The footpath in the alleyway next to the railway at the back of Nettleton Road is overgrown with brambles and nettles. It is making it difficult to walk along it. Particularly children who are going to school. This has been the case all summer. It needs someone to come and cut it back.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Nettleton Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement broken up near No 29 and other parts., 6th September
item.description:
The pavement has been like this for some time. It is dangerous for pedestrians. Repair please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hazelcroft, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old fence debris dumped, 6th September
item.description:
Problem first reported back in March. CBC has made orders for removal but no action has occurred. The debris is now partially covered with vegetation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Buckles Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycleway markings defaces, 6th September
item.description:
Cycleway markings systematically defaced along Kingsditch Lane from its junction with Swindon Road to Upperfield Road. This damage was reported in 2017 and no action has yet been taken to replace markings

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging tree branches extending into the road, 5th September
item.description:
I'm a bus driver and suffered a smashed upstairs window due to an overhanging branch from a tree, stretch is between the bus stop opposite invista and the vicarage lane stop. Luckily only one person was upstairs at the time but they were thankfully not injured. Incident happened around 8pm on 5th September 2023

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 73, Ermin Street, Brockworth, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ice Cream Van, 5th September
item.description:
Ice cream van sounding chimes after 7pm , and longer than the time permitted

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Manser Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leak, 5th September
item.description:
Water leaking from shut off valve on main road opposite side to champion chip shop..This has been leaking for over 2 weeks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Hesters Way Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown greenery obstructing footpath, 4th September
item.description:
Almost the whole footpath along Finlay way on the right hand side towards Lidl, is gradually getting more and more covered by overgrown plants, including weeds and nettles. I can’t push my pram that way anymore without nettles dangling into my baby’s pram or bumping into overgrown greenery. I have to wheel the pram on the grass to go around it which I shouldn’t have to do.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Bramble Chase, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
